FAQ.question: What is a Kerala Property Audit Report (Non-Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: A Kerala Property Audit Report is a detailed verification document that checks ownership, registration history, encumbrances, building details, and legal compliance of non-agricultural properties such as flats, houses, plots, and commercial units in Kerala.

FAQ.question: Why is the Property Audit Report important?
FAQ.answer: It ensures the property has a clear title, no legal disputes, no unpaid liabilities, and all documents are valid—helping buyers, owners, and banks make safe decisions before purchase or loan processing.

FAQ.question: What details are required to start the audit?
FAQ.answer: You need the district, Sub-Registrar Office (SRO), document number, registration year, property address, survey/resurvey number, and owner details.

FAQ.question: How long does the audit process take?
FAQ.answer: The audit typically takes 24–48 hours, depending on the availability of records and depth of verification.

FAQ.question: What will I receive in the final audit report?
FAQ.answer: You will receive a detailed report containing ownership verification, document checks, encumbrance status, tax records, building/property compliance checks, risk findings, and recommended next steps.
